about.summary: EasyGUI is a module for very simple, very easy GUI programming in Python.  EasyGUI is different from other GUI generators in that EasyGUI is NOT event-driven.  Instead, all GUI interactions are invoked by simple function calls.

name: easygui
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "easygui" %}
{% set version = "0.98.1" %}

package:
  name: "{{ name|lower }}"
  version: "{{ version }}"

source:
  url: "https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz"
  sha256: "dbc89afbb1aca83830ea4af568eb2491654e16b2706a14d040757fdf1fafbbfe"

build:
  number: 0
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python
  run:
    - python

test:
  requires:
    - xorg-libx11  # [linux]
  imports:
    - easygui
    - easygui.boxes

about:
  home: "https://github.com/robertlugg/easygui"
  license: "BSD 3-clause"
  license_family: "BSD"
  license_file: "LICENSE"
  summary: "EasyGUI is a module for very simple, very easy GUI programming in Python.  EasyGUI is different from other GUI generators in that EasyGUI is NOT event-driven.  Instead, all GUI interactions are invoked by simple function calls."

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - marcelotrevisani
